snippet: A detective who shot an unarmed driver in Queens had been hailed for bravery but also named in two lawsuits claiming abuse.
abstract: New York City Police Detective Hassan Hamdy, who killed unarmed driver Noel Polanco in a traffic stop on the Grand Central Parkway in Queens, has been hailed for bravery on the job in the past--but has also been named in two lawsuits claiming police abuse.

byline.original: By WENDY RUDERMAN and J. DAVID GOODMAN
byline.contributor: Randy Leonard and Alex Vadukul contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A detective who shot an unarmed driver in Queens had been hailed for bravery but also named in two lawsuits claiming abuse.

headline.seo: Portrait of Detective in Fatal Shooting of Noel Polanco
headline.main: Portrait of Detective in Shooting: Hero, but Subject of Suits
headline.print_headline: Portrait of Detective in Fatal Shooting: Hero, but Subject of Suits
